basic.description: This course is designed to provide individuals without business-oriented educational backgrounds with the fundamental knowledge of the various information technologies and systems commonly encountered in the business environment. In addition to gaining a basic understanding of the underlying technologies, more importantly the student gains the knowledge of how to strategically apply them in a business or organizational setting. Cannot be applied for credit for any graduate business degree.
basic.subject: ISM
basic.title: Fundamentals of Managing Information Technologies
